meanings.definition: A school for children who are too young for elementary school.
meanings.sent1: My sister goes to preschool to learn and play with other kids.
meanings.sent2: I remember my time at preschool when I was a little child.
meanings.sent3: At preschool, the children had a fun time painting and singing together.
meanings.sent4: The preschool was like a colorful garden where young minds blossomed.
meanings.sent5: The preschool building was filled with laughter and joy every day.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the education of children before they enter elementary school.
meanings.sent1: The preschool teacher taught us how to count and read simple words.
meanings.sent2: I bought my nephew some preschool books to help him learn before school.
meanings.sent3: The preschool curriculum included fun activities like storytelling and drawing.
meanings.sent4: Her preschool approach to teaching was gentle and nurturing.
meanings.sent5: The preschool environment was warm and welcoming for young learners.
